Class ServerSide.ColorPicker

java.lang.Object
ServerSide.Component
ServerSide.ColorPicker
Enclosing class:
ServerSide
public class ServerSide.ColorPicker extends ServerSide.Component
Represents a int picker component, extending the ServerSide.Component class. This component allows users to select a int from a predefined set of int options displayed as circles.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description

    Constructs a ColorPicker component with specified location and dimensions.

  • Constructor Details

    • ColorPicker

      public ColorPicker(int x, int y, int cWidth, int cHeight)
      Constructs a ColorPicker component with specified location and dimensions. Initializes the component and sets up the initial drawing state.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the int picker.
      y - the y-coordinate of the int picker.
      cWidth - the width of the int picker.
      cHeight - the height of the int picker.

  • Method Details

    • drawComponent

      public void drawComponent()
      Draws the int picker component on the screen. Defines the visual layout of the int picker, drawing a series of colored circles each representing a selectable int .
      Overrides:
      drawComponent in class ServerSide.Component

    • updatePosition

      public boolean updatePosition()
      Updates the position of the int selection based on user interaction. This method can be called to handle user clicks.
      Returns:
      true if the int picker's position was updated, false otherwise.

    • getColor

      public int getColor()
      Retrieves the int at the current selected position within the int picker. This method should be used after a call to updatePosition() confirms a int selection.
      Returns:
      the int at the current position as an integer.
